ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PRE-OPERATIONAL INSPECTION CHECKLIST
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You will be asked to identify five checklist items of the digger derrick that are part of the pre-operational inspection.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PRE-OPERATIONAL INSPECTION CHECKLIST
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: One at a time, you will describe how you would inspect it and what deficiencies you would look for. You have approximately one minute per item.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PRE-OPERATIONAL INSPECTION CHECKLIST
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for each incorrectly identified inspection item.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: CHAIN IN CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives the start signal, timing will begin. You will raise the chain about 10 ft. off the ground to clear obstacles and personnel and land the chain in the landing area.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: CHAIN IN CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You must avoid contacting any part of the course. Once the chain is under control in the designated area, the examiner will give you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: CHAIN IN CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
- Dragging or contact of the chain outside of landing area     
- Hook touching ground     
- Hook or chain contacting any part of the course or truck     
- Lifting the chain off the ground after initial contact inside the landing area     
- Exceeding optimum time (1 1/2 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: HAND SIGNALS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: The examiner will give you four hand signals to bring the chain back to the original location.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: HAND SIGNALS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Hoist and stop
-   Swing (left or right) and stop
-   Lower the load and stop
-   Boom (up or down) and stop
-   Telescope (in our out) and stop
-   Boom down and raise load and stop
-   Boom up and lower load and stop
-   Any above signal given slowly and stop
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Any of the following signals may be given, in any order:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: HAND SIGNALS
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for missing any of the hand signals.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4A: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - FORWARD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Prior to corridor task, you will be allowed one minute to lift test weight and position it inside the designated area.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4A: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - FORWARD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives the start signal, timing will begin. Guide the Test Weight through the corridor.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4A: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - FORWARD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Avoid contacting anything, but keep the chain on the ground, and place the test weight inside the circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4A: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - FORWARD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Knocking ball off pole
-   Moving pole base off line
-   Knocking pole over
-   Chain leaving ground
-   Passing poles with chain off ground
-   Load touching ground
-   Circumventing the course
-   Exceeding optimum time (4 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4A: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - FORWARD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once in the circle, the examiner will give you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4B: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - REVERSE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, timing will begin. Guide the Test Weight back through the corridor.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4B: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - REVERSE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Avoid contacting anything, keep the chain on the ground, and place the test weight inside the circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4B: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - REVERSE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Knocking ball off pole
-   Moving pole base off line
-   Knocking pole over
-   Chain leaving ground
-   Passing poles with chain off ground
-   Load touching ground
-   Circumventing the course
-   Exceeding optimum time (4 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4B: NEGOTIATE CORRIDOR - REVERSE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once in the circle, the examiner will give you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5A: UNSTOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, safely unstow the auger and contact ground in preparation to dig.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5A: UNSTOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Unstowing boom at less than a 45° angle
-   Unstowing at high speed
-   Shock loading of auger strap
-   Leaving boom fully extended/retracted
-   Auger contacting the ground out of plumb
-   Boom extended as auger leaves storage bracket
-   Exceeding maximum time (5 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5A: UNSTOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Indicate to the examiner when you are done.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5B: AUGER HOLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, auger a hole.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5B: AUGER HOLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Dig until flights are no longer visible and the examiner gives you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5B: AUGER HOLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You may ask for assistance to plumb the auger.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5B: AUGER HOLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5B: AUGER HOLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once the flights are no longer visible, the examiner will give you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5C: STOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, safely stow auger.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5C: STOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When ready, signal the proctor to assist in connecting the auger strap to the pin.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5C: STOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Auger off ground for strap attachment
-   Stowing at high speed
-   Stowing boom at less than a 45° angle
-   Improper wind-up procedure
-   Over-wrapping
-   Shock loading of auger strap
-   Auger not resting on latch
-   Boom extended as auger enters storage bracket
-   Exceeding maximum time (5 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 5C: STOW AUGER
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Indicate to the examiner when you are done.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6A: PICK UP UTILITY POLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, pick up the utility pole and place securely in the guides a few inches off the ground. Keep the pole butt within the designated area.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6A: PICK UP UTILITY POLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You may ask for assistance in the final placement of the utility pole in the guides.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6A: PICK UP UTILITY POLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Dragging pole butt outside designated area
-   Contacting obstruction
-   Pole guides supporting weight of utility pole
-   Raising utility pole more than 3 ft.
-   Exceeding maximum time (10 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6A: PICK UP UTILITY POLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once the task is completed, the examiner will give you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6A: PICK UP UTILITY POLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: For safety reasons, if at any point you lose control of the utility pole, the examiner will be forced to stop the task and your exam will end.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6B: PLACE UTILITY POLE IN DESIGNATED AREA
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal, timing will begin. Place the utility pole inside the designated area.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6B: PLACE UTILITY POLE IN DESIGNATED AREA
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once inside the area, lower the utility pole until the examiner gives you the stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6B: PLACE UTILITY POLE IN DESIGNATED AREA
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Avoid contacting the ground or obstructions.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6B: PLACE UTILITY POLE IN DESIGNATED AREA
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-   Raising utility pole more than 3 ft.
-   Contacting PVC pole base/ground
-   Pole guides supporting weight of utility pole
-   Lowering utility pole out of guides
-   Knocking ball off PVC pole
-   Knocking PVC pole over
-   Exceeding optimum time (1 1/2 minutes)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 6B: PLACE UTILITY POLE IN DESIGNATED AREA
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You will then be assisted in putting the utility pole back on the ground.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 7: STOW BOOM IN CRADLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: When the examiner gives you the start signal stow the boom in cradle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 7: STOW BOOM IN CRADLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Apply safe shutdown procedures prior to leaving operator station.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 7: STOW BOOM IN CRADLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-  Boom not fully retracted
-  Load line not fully retracted
-  Leaving boom out of cradle
-  Exceeding maximum time
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 7: STOW BOOM IN CRADLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Indicate to the examiner when you are done.

ceterms:assessmentExampleDescription: Candidates must watch a video showing them what is required during the practical exam. Video is also available on NCCCO website.
ceterms:assessmentOutput: All candidates receive a score report of their performance. Examination results are mailed to candidates approximately 12 business days after the receipt of Practical Examination score sheets by NCCCO. Both the Practical Examination and the scoring system have been validated and verified by NCCCO’s pilot testing program. A percentage score of 78 represents the minimum passing score for the Digger Derrick Operator Practical Examination.
ceterms:description:
The Digger Derrick Operator Practical Examination demonstrates digger derrick operation proficiency. The seven tasks that make up the Practical Examination are:

    Task 1: Pre-operational Inspection Checklist
    Task 2: Place chain in Circle
    Task 3: Follow Hand Signals
    Task 4: Negotiate Corridor with Test Weight
    Task 5: Auger a Hole
    Task 6: Pick up a Pole
    Task 7: Stow Boom and Shut-down Procedures

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:name: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Practical Exam
ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Practical Exam (new candidates)

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:name: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Practical Exam
ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: Digger Derrick Operator Practical Exam (current CCO-certified Mobile Crane Operators or new candidates who are registering for Mobile Crane Operator exams at same time)

ceterms:name: CCO Digger Derrick Operator Practical Exam
ceterms:scoringMethodDescription:
Once you have completed the Practical Examination:

    The examiner will record your performance.
    The examiner is not permitted to review your score sheet or discuss your performance on the test.
    Exam results will be mailed to you within approximately twelve business days of NCCCO’s receipt of the score sheets from the examiner.
